name: Programs accessing relational Databases must include the SQLCA Copybook
description:
This rule searches for Cobol Programs that access a database and that do not include the SQLCA copybook.
Commands containing DECLARE TABLE or DECLARE CURSOR are not taken into account.
output:
This report lists all programs accessing databases and which do not include the SQLCA copybook. It provides the following information:
- Cobol Program full name
rationale: Each database access should be checked thanks to the variables defined in the SQLCA copybook. This copybook should be always included in the programs which access relational databases.
reference: HP - SQL Cobol Application Programming Guide
remediation: For each program accessing a relational database, then check if it includes the SQLCA copybook. If not, add this copybook in the DATA DIVISION and control the return code after each SQL queries.
total: Number of programs accessing relational databases
